author: Hugo Ojeda
title: Wrap NTFs
description: There is a great opportunity to bring NTFS tokens to the DEFI market

assessments.note: While the proposal itself is very scarce, the provided links in the comment section aid in understanding the value.
The proposal seems a little lite on content to convince me that it effectively addresses the challenge. Further revision and collaboration with the community to grow the idea is required.

The problem statement is very vague; It doesn't explain what problem bringing NFTs to the DEFI market would solve. The proposer provides links to several other NFT related projects, but they all seem very disparate. The link to nftfi.com (NFT collateralized loans) sounds the most like what the author is describing in their detailed plan, but this is not clear. What are the other DEFI platforms that users are investing in? Would also recommend to check spelling of acronyms to improve clarity of proposal.

While the proposal generally seems to be a useful idea to utilize NFTs and connect them to decentralized finance, NFTs are (despite currently beeing hyped) so far still a niche thing that is not understood or utilized by a lot of users, hence this project will most likely only have limited effect on the challenge of successfully providing benefit to as many users as possible. Even more so given the fact that a very vague plan without any information about how it is going to be implemented is presented, which makes this more a pitch than a proposal and unlikely that it was well planned.

wNTFs are being discussed and used in other DeFi ecosystems, and it's important to develop something like this in the Cardano ecosystem as well. Although, the proposer only describes the wNFTs and how the system work, but does not give enough detail about its implementation and how it would connect to the ecosystem. More information is needed in this regard.

The one sentence paragraph of the description doesn't make it clear what the proposal is about, yet the links provided have given some insight into what the proposer might have wanted to suggest. Highly recommend revisions to the proposal and reapplying with a re-written one in the next fund.

Draft proposal. There is no clarity as to which problem this proposal seeks to solve. The problem statement doesn't describe a problem. The absence of a plan, goals or metrics makes it impossible to identify how the proposal addresses the challenge. I recommend that the proposer detail the proposal so that we can give appropriate feedback.
The listed experience is not enough to warrant a high confidence in a successful implementation. No budget has been listed either.

I was unable to verify the experience of the proposer although I am inclined to think they understand NFT's and the potential marketplace. The plan lacks any real detail about how this proposal will proceed. Links to work already completed or pending would have been good to see.

The proposer does not give much information as to how the 20000 ADA requested would be used. The proposer does not clearly explain what their role would be in implementing this project. The proposer has relevant experience as a software engineer which might be useful in implementing smart contracts for example, but doesn't state if they have any experience with implementing a smart contract. It would be useful to specify the specific skills required to meet that target goals. They also do not state any experience with decentralized finance beyond being an entrepreneur.

While, at least according to their linked in profile, the proposer has experience in software development, the plan presented does not indicate that the proposal has been planned in depth or that the cost assessment has a solid foundation. The current plan makes it seem unlikely that the proposal will be implemented with success.

The information about if it's a team or a single person committed to the project or not should be included. It seems to be a task for a group of developers, so if a single person is committed so far, a plan for hiring should be included. Also, the budget should be broken down to better explain the required amount, and related to a roadmap.
Detail plan required to enable estimation of success probability.

The proposer describes vaguely his past experience, but provides no proof of it. The single phrase plan does not convey a a clear idea, has some spelling errors, giving the impression that it was written in a hurry.

Draft proposal. There is no clarity as to what this proposal seeks to develop, there is no plan, just a draft idea for wrapping NFTs. Without a solid implementation plan, there is no way to judge the aptitude of the proposer in relation to the experiences described.
While a overview of the functionality has been provided, there is no information on how to implement this. Success/progress is not defined.

Like the idea and recognise that the proposal has merit but cannot assess feasibility without further information. I would recommend proposer establish further collaboration within the PC community to further this idea.

There are no clear goals or milestones so it is difficult to assess the target for success. If the proposal is to "create a platform to provide NFT collateralized loans on Cardano", then it can be assumed that it effectively addresses the challenge as it would provide additional utility, but it is unclear if this is the actual intent of the proposal.

While the proposal provides some examples about the concept in action, it does not present any roadmap or milestones on how the plan is going to be implemented. In this form it can mot be considered very audible

The plan to develop a platform to negotiate wNFTs is not included. The proposal should include information about roadmap, KPIs, milestones an other information to make it auditable. Definition of success is not clear as well, and risks are not mapped. It is not possible to assess its auditability as it is.
detailed plan required to assess feasibility. More information required on exactly what is intended to be done to see how it addresses the challenge.
The proposal would be better re-submitted in a future fund with a revised project description, that would also contain a roadmap, a detailed budget, metrics  etc.
Draft proposal. There is no information to audit this proposal. I recommend that the proposer elaborate the proposal based on the Catalyst documentation.

solution: Give tocken NTFs the opportunity to participate in DEFI platforms by using NTFS wrap
